option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"/Users/solanobarbeito/PycharmProjects/PersonalWebsite":"{\"/europe_landing_page.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that displays a website for a photographer named José María Barbeito. It includes a header with navigation links, a landing header, and several sections that display galleries of photographs from different European countries. The file also includes a footer with copyright information and links to the photographer\\u0027s GitHub and LinkedIn profiles.\\n\\nThere are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file is primarily focused on the structure and layout of the website, with the content and styling being handled through CSS.\",\"/css/projectstyling.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet that defines the styles for a web page. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the styles for various elements on the page, such as the body, project container, project columns, project text, page header, gallery container, and video player. The styles include layout, typography, colors, and responsive adjustments for smaller screens. The file also includes a footer section with a fixed position at the bottom of the page.\\n\\nIn summary, this CSS file provides the visual styling for a web page that includes a project section with images and text, a gallery section, and a video player, as well as a fixed footer at the bottom of the page.\",\"/woodworking_project_page.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that showcases the woodworking projects of José María Barbeito. It includes a header with navigation links, a project section with images and descriptions, a gallery section with additional woodworking images, and a footer with copyright information and social media links. The file uses JavaScript libraries like Masonry and imagesLoaded to create a responsive and dynamic image gallery.\\n\\nThere are no classes defined in this file, but there are the following functions:\\n\\n`document.addEventListener(\\\"DOMContentLoaded\\\", function () { ... })`: This function is executed when the HTML document has finished loading, and it initializes the Masonry layout for the image gallery.\",\"/gallery template.html\":\"This file is a HTML document that creates a gallery page for a photographer\\u0027s work. It includes a header with navigation links, a main section with a gallery of images, a section for panoramic images, and a footer. The file also includes JavaScript code to implement a modal window for viewing individual images, as well as functionality for zooming and panning the images within the modal.\\n\\n`Masonry`: A JavaScript library used to create a responsive, grid-like layout for the gallery images.\\n\\n`updateTransform`: A function that updates the transform properties of the modal image to apply the current zoom and pan values.\\n\\n`centerImage`: A function that resets the pan offsets of the modal image to center it.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow`: A function that closes the modal window when the user clicks outside the image or presses the Escape key.\\n\\n`onMouseMove`: A function that updates the pan position of the modal image while the user is dragging it.\\n\\n`onMouseUp`: A function that stops the dragging behavior when the user releases the mouse button.\",\"/wolfspeed.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that showcases the work experience of José María Barbeito at Wolfspeed, a leading semiconductor company. The file includes a header with navigation links, a section for the introduction to Wolfspeed, a section for the work experience, and a footer with contact information. There are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file serves as a portfolio-style webpage to highlight the author\\u0027s internship experiences at Wolfspeed.\",\"/tanks_project_page.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that showcases a portfolio website for José María Barbeito, featuring his work on poison dart frog vivariums and aquascaping. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but instead uses HTML and CSS to structure and style the content.\\n\\nThe main elements in the file are:\\n\\n`page-header`: Displays the website\\u0027s header with the author\\u0027s name, navigation links, and social media icons.\\n`project-container`: Organizes the project content into columns with images and text.\\n`project-column`: Displays the images for each project.\\n`project-text`: Provides the text description for each project.\\n`project-video`: Embeds a video player for the aquascape project.\\n`footer`: Includes copyright information and links to the author\\u0027s GitHub and LinkedIn profiles.\\n\\nOverall, this file creates a visually appealing and informative portfolio website to showcase the author\\u0027s work in the field of aquariums and vivariums.\",\"/js/app.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`window.addEventListener(\\\"DOMContentLoaded\\\", function () { ... })`: This function sets up an event listener for the `DOMContentLoaded` event, which is triggered when the initial HTML document has been completely loaded and parsed. Inside this function, it handles the submission of a contact form, including success and error handling.\\n\\n`ajax(method, url, data, success, error)`: This function is a helper function that sends an AJAX request using the provided method, URL, and data, and calls the provided success or error callback functions based on the response.\\n\\n`$(window).scroll(function () { ... })`: This function sets up an event listener for the `scroll` event on the window object, and toggles the visibility of a \\\"Back to Top\\\" button based on the current scroll position.\\n\\n`backToTopBtn.on(\\\"click\\\", function (e) { ... })`: This function sets up a click event listener for the \\\"Back to Top\\\" button, which scrolls the page back to the top when clicked.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up event listeners and functions to handle a contact form submission and a \\\"Back to Top\\\" button functionality.\",\"/switzerland_gallery.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that displays a gallery of images and panoramas of Switzerland. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`Masonry`: A JavaScript library that creates a responsive grid layout for the gallery images.\\n\\n`imagesLoaded`: A JavaScript library that ensures the images are fully loaded before the Masonry layout is applied.\\n\\n`hoverItems`: A function that adds a hover effect to the gallery items and panorama sections, displaying a text overlay.\\n\\n`updateTransform`: A function that updates the transform of the modal image based on the current zoom and pan values.\\n\\n`centerImage`: A function that centers the modal image by resetting the pan offsets.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow`: A function that closes the modal window when the user clicks outside the image or presses the Escape key.\\n\\n`onMouseMove`: A function that updates the pan of the modal image while the user is dragging.\\n\\n`onMouseUp`: A function that stops the panning of the modal image when the user releases the mouse.\\n\\nThe file also includes event listeners for the gallery images and panoramas to open them in a modal window, as well as functionality for zooming and panning the modal image.\",\"/about.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that creates a personal website for José María Barbeito. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`*`: This file resets the default styles and sets global styles for the website.\\n\\n`page-header`: This class styles the header section of the website, including the title, navigation links, and social media icons.\\n\\n`about-container`: This class styles the about section of the website, including the profile image and text.\\n\\n`about-image`: This class styles the profile image in the about section.\\n\\n`about-text`: This class styles the text content in the about section.\\n\\n`btn`: This class styles the buttons in the about section.\\n\\n`footer`: This class styles the footer section of the website, including the copyright information and links to the author\\u0027s GitHub and LinkedIn profiles.\\n\\nThe file creates a personal website for José María Barbeito, including an about section with his profile image and biography, as well as a header with navigation links and social media icons, and a footer with copyright information and links to the author\\u0027s social media profiles.\",\"/beekeeping_project_page.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that showcases a project on beekeeping. It includes a header with navigation links, a project section with images and text, a gallery section with a Masonry layout, and a footer with copyright information and links to the developer\\u0027s GitHub and LinkedIn profiles.\\n\\n`page-header`: Styles the header section of the page.\\n`navigation`: Styles the navigation links in the header.\\n`social-icons`: Styles the social media icons in the header.\\n`project-container`: Styles the main project section.\\n`project-column`: Styles the image columns in the project section.\\n`project-text`: Styles the text content in the project section.\\n`gallery-wrapper`: Styles the gallery section.\\n`gallery-container`: Styles the container for the gallery.\\n`gallery`: Styles the individual gallery items.\\n`gallery-item`: Styles each image in the gallery.\\n\\n`document.addEventListener(\\\"DOMContentLoaded\\\", function () { ... })`: Initializes the Masonry layout for the gallery section when the page content has finished loading.\",\"/greece_gallery.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that displays a gallery of images from Greece, along with a section for panoramic images. The file includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`document`: This file is an HTML document that displays a gallery of images from Greece, along with a section for panoramic images.\\n\\n`header-content`: This class represents the header content of the page, including the title, navigation menu, and social media icons.\\n\\n`main-section`: This class represents the main section of the page, which includes a background image and a content area.\\n\\n`gallery-wrapper`: This class represents the wrapper for the image gallery.\\n\\n`gallery-container`: This class represents the container for the image gallery.\\n\\n`gallery`: This class represents the image gallery itself, which is created using the Masonry layout library.\\n\\n`gallery-item`: This class represents each individual image in the gallery.\\n\\n`panoramas`: This section displays a collection of panoramic images from Greece.\\n\\n`panorama-section`: This class represents each individual panoramic image.\\n\\n`modal`: This class represents the modal window that displays a larger version of the selected image, with the ability to zoom and pan the image.\\n\\n`updateTransform()`: This function updates the transform of the modal image based on the current zoom and pan values.\\n\\n`centerImage()`: This function resets the pan offsets of the modal image to center it.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow()`: This function closes the modal window.\\n\\n`onMouseMove()`: This function handles the mouse movement during the panning of the modal image.\\n\\n`onMouseUp()`: This function handles the mouse up event during the panning of the modal image.\",\"/rde_work in progress.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that showcases the work experience of José María Barbeito at Wolfspeed, a leading innovator in wide-bandgap semiconductor technology. The file includes a header with navigation links, a section for the Wolfspeed introduction, a section for the work experience details, and a footer with social media links.\\n\\nThere are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file is primarily focused on presenting the work experience information in a structured and visually appealing manner.\",\"/css/europe.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a landing page for Europe. It does not contain any classes or functions, but instead defines the styles for various elements on the page, such as the header, page header, gallery rows, and footer.\\n\\n`body`: Defines the base styles for the body of the page, including the font, background color, and margin/padding.\\n\\n`header.landing-header`: Styles the header section of the landing page, including the text alignment, padding, background color, and font size.\\n\\n`page-header`: Styles the header section of the page, including the width, background color, text alignment, padding, border, and box shadow.\\n\\n`page-header .header-content`: Styles the content within the page header, including the maximum width and centering.\\n\\n`page-header h1`: Styles the main heading within the page header, including the font family, font size, and font weight.\\n\\n`page-header hr`: Styles the horizontal rule within the page header, including the border, width, and margin.\\n\\n`page-header .navigation`: Styles the navigation links within the page header, including the margin, font size, and hover effect.\\n\\n`gallery-row`: Styles the gallery rows, including the position, display, alignment, height, background size and position, color, and overflow.\\n\\n`gallery-row::before`: Styles the optional overlay for the gallery rows, including the position, size, and background color.\\n\\n`gallery-content`: Styles the content within the gallery rows, including the position, text alignment, and z-index.\\n\\n`gallery-content h2`: Styles the heading within the gallery content, including the font size and margin.\\n\\n`gallery-content a`: Styles the link within the gallery content, including the display, padding, background color, color, text decoration, border radius, and font weight.\\n\\n`gray-bg`: Styles the alternate row style with a gray background color and no overlay.\\n\\n`footer`: Styles the footer of the page, including the text alignment, padding, background color, color, and font size.\\n\\n`footer a`: Styles the links within the footer, including the color and text decoration.\",\"/united_kingdom_gallery.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that displays a gallery of images from the United Kingdom. It includes a header with navigation links, a main section with a background image and content, a gallery section with 92 images, a panorama section with 5 panoramic images, and a footer. The file also includes JavaScript code to implement a modal window for viewing the images in full screen, with functionality for zooming and panning the images.\\n\\n`Masonry`: A JavaScript library used to create a responsive, grid-like layout for the gallery images.\\n\\n`imagesLoaded`: A JavaScript library used to ensure that the images are fully loaded before the Masonry layout is applied.\\n\\n`hoverItems`: A function that adds a hover effect to the gallery items and panorama sections, displaying a text overlay when the user hovers over them.\\n\\n`updateTransform`: A function that updates the transform of the modal image based on the current zoom and pan values.\\n\\n`centerImage`: A function that resets the pan offsets of the modal image to center it.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow`: A function that closes the modal window when the user clicks the close button or outside the modal.\\n\\n`onMouseMove`: A function that updates the pan of the modal image while the user is dragging it.\\n\\n`onMouseUp`: A function that stops the panning of the modal image when the user releases the mouse.\",\"/css/gallerystyle.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet that defines the styles for a web page. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a set of styles for various elements on the page. Here\\u0027s a summary of the main sections:\\n\\n`body, h1, h2, p, ul, li, a`: Resets the default margin, padding, and box-sizing for common HTML elements.\\n\\n`body`: Sets the background color and text color for the page.\\n\\n`page-header`: Styles the header section of the page, including the title, navigation links, and a horizontal rule.\\n\\n`main-section`: Styles the main content area, including a full-screen background image and centered content.\\n\\n`gallery-container`: Styles the gallery section, including a responsive grid layout for the images.\\n\\n`panorama-section`: Styles a section for displaying panoramic images, with a centered content area.\\n\\n`hover-text`: Adds a hover effect to the gallery items, displaying a text overlay.\\n\\n`imageModal`: Styles a modal dialog for displaying a zoomed-in image.\\n\\n`panorama-btn`: Styles a button for navigating to the panorama section.\\n\\n`panorama-title`: Styles the title and description for the panorama section.\\n\\n`footer`: Styles the footer section of the page.\\n\\nOverall, this CSS file provides a comprehensive set of styles for a web page with a header, main content area, gallery, panorama section, and footer.\",\"/astro.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that displays a gallery of astrophotography images. It uses JavaScript to implement a modal window for zooming and panning the images, as well as a Masonry layout for the gallery. The file also includes a header with navigation links and a footer with copyright information and social media links.\\n\\n`Masonry`: A JavaScript library that creates a dynamic grid layout for the gallery images.\\n\\n`imagesLoaded`: A JavaScript library that ensures the Masonry layout is updated after all images have finished loading.\\n\\n`updateTransform()`: A function that updates the CSS transform of the modal image based on the current scale and translation values.\\n\\n`centerImage()`: A function that resets the translation values to center the modal image.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow()`: A function that closes the modal window when the user clicks outside the image or presses the Escape key.\\n\\n`onMouseMove()`: A function that updates the translation values of the modal image during a drag operation.\\n\\n`onMouseUp()`: A function that stops the drag operation and resets the cursor.\",\"/united_states_gallery.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that displays a gallery of images from the United States. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`Masonry`: A JavaScript library that creates a responsive grid layout for the gallery images.\\n\\n`imagesLoaded`: A JavaScript library that ensures the gallery images are loaded before the Masonry layout is applied.\\n\\n`hoverItems`: A function that adds a hover effect to the gallery items and panorama sections, displaying a text overlay when the user hovers over them.\\n\\n`updateTransform`: A function that updates the transform of the modal image based on the user\\u0027s zoom and pan actions.\\n\\n`centerImage`: A function that centers the modal image by resetting the pan offsets.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow`: A function that closes the modal window when the user clicks the close button or outside the modal.\\n\\n`onMouseMove`: A function that updates the position of the modal image during a drag operation.\\n\\n`onMouseUp`: A function that stops the drag operation when the user releases the mouse button.\\n\\nThe file also includes event listeners for zooming and panning the modal image, as well as for opening and closing the modal window.\",\"/css/work.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a web page. It does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines the styles for various elements on the page, such as the body, sections, containers, headings, job listings, images, and an introduction section with a logo. The styles include layout, colors, typography, and animations. The overall purpose of this CSS file is to provide a consistent and visually appealing design for the web page.\",\"/particles.json\":\"This file appears to be a configuration object for the Particles.js library, which is a lightweight JavaScript library for creating particle effects on web pages. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a set of properties that define the behavior and appearance of the particle system. Here\\u0027s a summary of the main properties:\\n\\n`particles`: This object defines the properties of the particles, such as their number, color, shape, opacity, size, and movement.\\n`interactivity`: This object defines the interactive behavior of the particles, such as how they respond to mouse hover and click events.\\n`retina_detect`: This property enables the particle system to adapt to high-resolution displays.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides a detailed configuration for a particle effect that can be used on a web page, with customizable properties for the particles and their interactive behavior.\",\"/rde.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that represents a webpage for José María Barbeito\\u0027s work experience, specifically focused on the Liquid Rocketry Lab Advanced Projects. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but it includes the following elements:\\n\\n`page-header`: The header section of the webpage, which includes the name, navigation links, and social media icons.\\n`horizontal-bar`: A horizontal bar that separates the header from the main content.\\n`intro`: The main section of the webpage, which displays information about the Liquid Rocketry Lab Advanced Projects.\\n`footer`: The footer section of the webpage, which includes copyright information and links to the author\\u0027s GitHub and LinkedIn profiles.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a web-based presentation of the author\\u0027s work experience, specifically focusing on the Liquid Rocketry Lab Advanced Projects, which is still in development.\",\"/costa_rica_gallery.html\":\"This file is a HTML document that displays a gallery of images from Costa Rica. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`document`: This file is a HTML document that displays a gallery of images from Costa Rica.\\n\\n`header-content`: This class contains the header content, including the title, navigation links, and social media icons.\\n\\n`main-section`: This class contains the main content section, including the gallery background image and a description of the Costa Rica trip.\\n\\n`gallery-wrapper`: This class contains the gallery container and the individual gallery items.\\n\\n`gallery-item`: This class represents each individual image in the gallery.\\n\\n`hover-text`: This class represents the text overlay that appears when hovering over a gallery item or panorama section.\\n\\n`panoramas`: This section contains a collection of panoramic images from the Costa Rica trip.\\n\\n`modal`: This class represents the modal window that appears when a gallery image is clicked, allowing the user to zoom and pan the image.\\n\\n`updateTransform()`: This function updates the transform of the modal image based on the current zoom and pan values.\\n\\n`centerImage()`: This function resets the pan offsets to center the modal image.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow()`: This function closes the modal window.\\n\\n`onMouseMove()`: This function handles the mouse movement during the panning of the modal image.\\n\\n`onMouseUp()`: This function handles the mouse up event during the panning of the modal image.\",\"/scotland_gallery.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that displays a gallery of images from Scotland, along with a modal window that allows users to view and interact with the images. The file includes several classes and functions to handle the gallery and modal functionality.\\n\\n`.page-header`: Defines the header section of the page, including the navigation menu and social media icons.\\n\\n`.main-section`: Displays the main content of the page, including a background image and a brief description.\\n\\n`.gallery-wrapper`: Wraps the gallery container and applies styling to the gallery.\\n\\n`.gallery-container`: Holds the gallery items and applies Masonry layout.\\n\\n`.gallery-item`: Represents each individual image in the gallery.\\n\\n`.panoramas`: Displays a section for panoramic images.\\n\\n`.panorama-section`: Represents each individual panoramic image.\\n\\n`document.addEventListener(\\\"DOMContentLoaded\\\", function () { ... })`: Initializes the Masonry layout for the gallery when the page content is loaded.\\n\\n`hoverItems.forEach(item \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: Adds hover effects to the gallery items and panoramic images.\\n\\n`galleryImages.forEach(image \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: Adds click event listeners to the gallery and panoramic images to open the modal window.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow()`: Closes the modal window when the user clicks the close button or outside the modal.\\n\\n`modal.addEventListener(\\u0027wheel\\u0027, (e) \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: Handles the zoom functionality of the image in the modal window.\\n\\n`modalImage.addEventListener(\\u0027mousedown\\u0027, (e) \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: Handles the panning functionality of the image in the modal window.\",\"/css/main.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS and HTML code for a personal website. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the styles and structure for various sections of the website, including:\\n\\n`html`: Defines the overall scroll behavior and resets the default margin and padding.\\n\\n`body`: Defines the background color and line height for the website.\\n\\n`a`: Defines the text decoration and color for links.\\n\\n`main-font`, `text-center`, `my-1`, `mx-1`, `h-100`, `container`, `text-blue`, `text-white`, `text-grey`, `text-dark-grey`, `bg-blue`, `bg-dark-grey`, `bg-white`, `btn`, `btn-blue`, `btn-dark`, `btn-blue-outline`: Defines various utility classes for styling text, backgrounds, and buttons.\\n\\n`btn-email`: Defines a custom button with an animated email icon.\\n\\n`blue-link-underline`, `flex`, `white-image`: Defines additional utility classes.\\n\\n`header`, `projects`, `education`, `skills`, `contact`, `footer`, `photography`: Defines the styles and structure for the different sections of the website, such as the header, projects, education, skills, contact, footer, and photography sections.\",\"/index.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML document that serves as the main page for a personal website. It does not contain any defined classes or functions, but it includes various sections and elements that make up the website\\u0027s structure and content. Here\\u0027s a summary of the main sections and elements:\\n\\n`\\u003cheader\\u003e`: Includes the website\\u0027s navigation menu, hero section with the user\\u0027s profile picture and introduction, and social media links.\\n\\n`\\u003csection id\\u003d\\\"work\\\"\\u003e`: Displays the user\\u0027s work experience, including details about their internships and projects.\\n\\n`\\u003csection id\\u003d\\\"projects\\\"\\u003e`: Showcases the user\\u0027s personal projects, such as aquariums, woodworking, and beekeeping.\\n\\n`\\u003csection id\\u003d\\\"photography\\\"\\u003e`: Presents the user\\u0027s photography work, organized into different categories like astrophotography, landscapes, and travel destinations.\\n\\n`\\u003csection id\\u003d\\\"skills\\\"\\u003e`: Displays the user\\u0027s technical skills, represented by various icons.\\n\\n`\\u003csection id\\u003d\\\"contact\\\"\\u003e`: Provides a contact form and links to the user\\u0027s email, resume, and LinkedIn profile.\\n\\n`\\u003cfooter\\u003e`: Includes the website\\u0027s logo and links to the user\\u0027s social media profiles.\\n\\nThe file also includes various CSS styles and JavaScript functionality to enhance the website\\u0027s appearance and interactivity.\",\"/argentina_gallery.html\":\"This file is a HTML document that creates a gallery template for displaying images of Argentina. It includes a header with navigation links, a main section with a background image and content, a gallery section with multiple images, a panorama section with larger panoramic images, and a footer with copyright information and links to the developer\\u0027s GitHub and LinkedIn profiles.\\n\\nThe file also includes JavaScript code that implements the following functionality:\\n\\n`Masonry`: Initializes a Masonry layout for the gallery section, allowing the images to be displayed in a responsive grid.\\n\\n`hoverItems`: Adds a hover effect to the gallery items and panorama sections, displaying a text overlay when the user hovers over them.\\n\\n`galleryImages`: Adds a click event listener to the gallery and panorama images, which opens a modal window to display the selected image in a larger size.\\n\\n`updateTransform`: Updates the transform of the modal image to apply the current zoom and pan values.\\n\\n`centerImage`: Resets the pan offsets to center the modal image.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow`: Closes the modal window when the user clicks the close button or outside the image area.\\n\\n`onMouseMove`: Handles the mouse movement during the panning of the modal image.\\n\\n`onMouseUp`: Handles the mouse up event during the panning of the modal image.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file appears to be a description of a personal portfolio website, and does not contain any classes or functions. The file summarizes the technologies used to build the website, which are HTML, SCSS, and JavaScript.\",\"/australia_gallery.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that displays a gallery of images from Australia. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`document`: This file is an HTML document that displays a gallery of images from Australia.\\n\\n`header.page-header`: This class represents the header section of the page, which includes the website title, navigation links, and social media icons.\\n\\n`div.main-section`: This class represents the main section of the page, which includes a background image and a content section with a title and description.\\n\\n`div.gallery-wrapper`: This class represents the container for the image gallery.\\n\\n`div.gallery`: This class represents the image gallery itself, which is created using the Masonry layout library.\\n\\n`div.gallery-item`: This class represents each individual image in the gallery, which includes a hover text overlay.\\n\\n`section#panoramas`: This section represents a collection of panoramic images from Australia.\\n\\n`section.panorama-section`: This class represents each individual panoramic image in the panoramas section.\\n\\n`footer`: This section represents the footer of the page, which includes copyright information and links to the author\\u0027s GitHub and LinkedIn profiles.\\n\\n`document.addEventListener(\\\"DOMContentLoaded\\\", function () { ... })`: This function is executed when the HTML document has finished loading, and it initializes the Masonry layout for the image gallery.\\n\\n`hoverItems.forEach(item \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: This function adds event listeners to each gallery item and panorama section, which show and hide the hover text overlay when the user hovers over the item.\\n\\n`galleryImages.forEach(image \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: This function adds event listeners to each gallery image and panorama image, which open a modal window when the user clicks on the image.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow()`: This function closes the modal window when the user clicks on the close button or outside the modal.\\n\\n`modal.addEventListener(\\u0027wheel\\u0027, (e) \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: This function handles the zooming functionality of the modal window when the user scrolls the mouse wheel.\\n\\n`modalImage.addEventListener(\\u0027mousedown\\u0027, (e) \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: This function handles the panning functionality of the modal window when the user clicks and drags the image.\",\"/france_gallery.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that displays a gallery of images from France, along with a modal window for viewing individual images in a larger size. The file also includes JavaScript code to implement the gallery and modal functionality.\\n\\n`document.addEventListener(\\\"DOMContentLoaded\\\", function () { ... })`: This function initializes the Masonry layout for the gallery, ensuring that the images are displayed in a responsive grid.\\n\\n`hoverItems.forEach(item \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: This function adds event listeners to the gallery items and panorama sections, allowing the hover text to be displayed and hidden when the user hovers over the items.\\n\\n`galleryImages.forEach(image \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: This function adds event listeners to the gallery and panorama images, allowing the user to click on an image and open it in a modal window.\\n\\n`closeModalWindow()`: This function closes the modal window when the user clicks on the close button or outside the modal.\\n\\n`modal.addEventListener(\\u0027wheel\\u0027, (e) \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: This function handles the zooming functionality of the image in the modal window, allowing the user to zoom in and out using the mouse wheel.\\n\\n`modalImage.addEventListener(\\u0027mousedown\\u0027, (e) \\u003d\\u003e { ... })`: This function handles the panning functionality of the image in the modal window, allowing the user to drag the image around.\"}"}
